\doxysection{sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket Class Reference}
\hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket}{}\label{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket}\index{sockpp::stream\_socket@{sockpp::stream\_socket}}

\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Base class for streaming sockets, such as TCP and Unix Domain. 

This is the streaming connection between two peers. It looks like a readable/writeable device.

\Hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket_ac4cb7249795c79a2cb3dec39da837337}\index{sockpp::stream\_socket@{sockpp::stream\_socket}!clone@{clone}}
\index{clone@{clone}!sockpp::stream\_socket@{sockpp::stream\_socket}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{clone()}{clone()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket_ac4cb7249795c79a2cb3dec39da837337} 
\mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket}{stream\+\_\+socket}} sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket\+::clone (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption}) const\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



Creates a new stream socket that refers to this one. 

This creates a new object with an independent lifetime, but refers back to this same socket. On most systems, this duplicates the file handle using the dup() call. A typical use of this is to have separate threads for reading and writing the socket. One thread would get the original socket and the other would get the cloned one. \begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A new stream socket object that refers to the same socket as this one. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\Hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket_a5fd9f1bba80974ed016f5878268e0865}\index{sockpp::stream\_socket@{sockpp::stream\_socket}!create@{create}}
\index{create@{create}!sockpp::stream\_socket@{sockpp::stream\_socket}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{create()}{create()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket_a5fd9f1bba80974ed016f5878268e0865} 
static \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{result}}$<$ \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket}{stream\+\_\+socket}} $>$ sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket\+::create (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{int}]{domain}{, }\item[{int}]{protocol}{ = {\ttfamily 0}}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [static]}}



Creates a socket with the specified communications characterics. 

Not that this is not normally how a socket is creates in the sockpp library. Applications would typically create a connector (client) or acceptor (server) socket which would take care of the details.

This is included for completeness or for creating different types of sockets than are supported by the library.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em domain} & The communications domain for the sockets (i.\+e. the address family) \\
\hline
{\em protocol} & The particular protocol to be used with the sockets\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A stream socket with the requested communications characteristics. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

virtual \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{result}}$<$ size\+\_\+t $>$ sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket\+::read\+\_\+n (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{void \texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}}]{buf}{, }\item[{size\+\_\+t}]{n}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [virtual]}}



Best effort attempts to read the specified number of bytes. 

This will make repeated read attempts until all the bytes are read in or until an error occurs. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em buf} & Buffer to get the incoming data. \\
\hline
{\em n} & The number of bytes to try to read. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
The number of bytes read on success, or {\itshape -\/1} on error. If successful, the number of bytes read should always be \textquotesingle{}n\textquotesingle{}. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

virtual \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{result}} sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket\+::write\+\_\+timeout (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{const microseconds \&}]{to}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [virtual]}}



Set a timeout for write operations. 

Sets the timout that the device uses for write operations. Not all devices support timouts, so the caller should prepare for failure. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em to} & The amount of time to wait for the operation to complete. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
{\itshape true} on success, {\itshape false} on failure. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
